maml:description.maml:para: Copy certificate and CRL files from ADCS to online repository directory

Enumerate all files in ADCS windows directory (C:\Windows\System32\Certsrv) and copies them to web repository. Certificate files with ADCS-style "<hostname>_<caname>.crt" file name will be renamed to just "<caname>.crt". All certs will also be exported as PEM files.
Path to repository directory
Valid values: "crl", "crt", or "all"
Valid values: "crl", "crt", or "all"
Path to repository directory

dev:remarks.maml:para: Processes both certificate and CRL files in C:\Windows\System32\Certsrv

maml:description.maml:para: Lists all Issuance policy OIDs registered in Active Directory
Issuance Policy OIDs are registered in Active Directory's Configuration partition.
Try to find Issuance Policy by name
Try to find Issuance Policy by name
Get linked Issuance Policies linked to Authentication Mechanism Assurance (AMA) groups
Issuance Policies in Active Directory can be linked to groups via Authentication Mechanism Assurance. This cmdlet lists all such links.
Filter by Issuance Policy name
Filter by Issuance Policy name

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all AMA Issuance Policy and group links

Install a signed CA certificate for intermediate CA
When deploying an intermediate CA you will receive a CSR file that needs to be signed by the superior CA. After this is done, this cmdlet installs and configures the CA certificate.
Certificate file

Install ADCS RSAT tools.
Install ADCS RSAT tools. On older Operating Systems you need to download them from Microsoft and run the installer first.
Install ADDS admin tools as well as ADCS.
Install ADDS admin tools as well as ADCS.

Backs up ADCS to given directory. Private key is not included by default, use -BackupKey to include it. Backups up CA database and configuration: 1. Registry values 2. Published templates 3. Installed local certificates

maml:description.maml:para: Generates a HTML index file for CDP/AIA repository

This cmdlet will generate a helpful HTML page containing web links to all CA certificates and CRL files in the given directory (SourcePath). You can include Javascript/CSS files of your choosing by using the CssFiles/JsFiles parameters. You can generate a default CSS file with the New-ZPkiRepoCssFile.

Recommendation: create both binary and PEM versions of each cert in the source directory. Follow this naming standard: cacert.crt and cacert.pem.crt. If you do the pem versions will be included on the same table row.
The cmdlet assumes the following layout of files in the generated HTML: -> index.html -> Repository/ -> cacert.crt -> cacert.pem.crt
Author anders !Ä!T! runesson D"Ö"T info
This directory will be scanned for crt/cer/crl files. It is assumed that files will be in a subdirectory named 'Repository' relative to the index.html file.
Path for generated index file.
Style sheet to include in html
Javascript to include in html
HTML title tag
HTML h1 tab
HTML header for the CA certs section
HTML header for the CA CRLs section

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-ZPkiWebsite -IisSiteName "ZampleWorks PKI web site" -HttpFqdn "pki.zampleworks.com" -LocalPath "C:\ADCS\Web"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Installs IIS (if not installed) and creates a web site to host HTTP CDP and AIA.

Update altSecIdentities on Active Directory user object based on certificate in ADCS db

Find an AD account by AdSamaccountname and search given CA db for a cert with matching CN and RequesterName. If multiple certs match, the last one will be used. You can supply a template name to limit cert search. Extract serialnumber and Issuer name from cert and set altSecIdentities accordingly.
AD Account name
Short name of certificate template
If you have multiple CAs use this parameter to filter on CA name.
Removes all preexisting entries from altSecurityIdentities attribute before setting.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
AD Account name
If you have multiple CAs use this parameter to filter on CA name.

Removes all preexisting entries from altSecurityIdentities attribute before setting.

maml:description.maml:para: Add/remove CDP and AIA URL configuration

the Fqdn and Path parameters are for building a complete HTTP URI. For example, $HttpCdpFqdn = my.server.com $HttpCdpPath = "Repository" the generated URI will start with "http://my.server.com/Repository"
